alert.note: Alert for Oswego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 08 at 10:58AM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive lake effect rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central New York, including the following county, Oswego. * WHEN...Until 130 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1056 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated an area of very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - The lake effect band will remain nearly stationary through the early afternoon. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area through the end of the warning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oswego, Sandy Island Beach State Park, Pulaski, Redfield, Selkirk Shores State Park, Mexico Point State Park, Nine Mile Point, Scriba, Richland, New Haven, Mexico, Orwell, Sandy Creek, Lacona, Parish, Altmar, Port Ontario, Howardville, Smartville and Salmon River Reservoir. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
